subsections.title: Offsets, National Calling Frequencies
subsections.label: subsec:offsets-national
prompts: Explain the concept of repeater frequency offset, including its purpose and common values in the 2 meter and 70 cm bands.
Describe the national calling frequency for FM simplex operations in the 2 meter band and its significance.
Discuss the appropriate procedure for calling another station on a repeater when you know the other station's call sign.
Explain how to respond to a station calling CQ and the importance of proper identification.
Describe the requirements for making on-the-air test transmissions, including the need for station identification.
Explain the meaning of the procedural signal 'CQ' and its use in amateur radio operations.
Discuss how a station indicates that it is listening on a repeater and looking for a contact.
Explain the concept of a band plan and its role in amateur radio operations beyond FCC privileges.
Define simplex communication and contrast it with duplex communication.
Describe the steps to take before calling CQ to ensure proper frequency usage and etiquette.
